Reviews.Title: “Will go back”
Reviews.Author: camperMountPearl
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, friendly helpful staff,Comfy beds and very convenient to have a European kitchen! Hotel directory a little outdated (breakfast is over at 10:30 not 1:00pm as it states in the directory) and you have to have a key to get into the workout room. Don't forget to ask when you check in and eveni if you're not working out you should go there just to see the view at night! Reasonably priced as well.....$680 for 6 nights includes all taxes. water pressure in shower is excellent and towels are plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: NLSteve
Reviews.Content: Great location on Sherbrooke just west of Peel. Hotel is rather dated but is clean. One block to Metro, two blocks to Ste. Catherine, ten minutes to Centre Bell & Crescent St. We travel to Montreal often and book hotels based on the deal we can get at the time and this one will now be added to our rotation. Note that the shuttle from the airport stops at Peel and Rene Levesque which is less than a ten minute walk from the hotel if you want to save the approximately $40 cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: AssiaMoretti
Reviews.Content: great value for the price. walking distance to nearby shopping and cafes. met my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good price, good room”
Reviews.Author: zlosnica15pl
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at this hotel i believe a total of three times (out of 4 that Ive been to Montreal) and I can never say a bad thing about it. Price is good, location is perfect (less than 5 minutes from I believe it is Rue St. Catherine) where all the good bars, restaurants etc are When I go to montreal I go for the attractions - not to sit in a hotel all day so I dont need Ritz Carlton standards. However I do need it to be clean, and within a good location with an attentive staff. I got everything I needed from this hotel. The rooftop pool is also nice in the summer :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aultom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good option for my group because there were three of us and we wanted three separate beds in the one room. Its on of the few hotels in Montreal offering this, although one of the beds is a pullout sofa. The hotel is nice and has good facilities but the staff were not too friendly. Although we were under the impression that we would have free internet, it was only available in the business centre. It was around 5 dollars per day in the bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Central location in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth C
Reviews.Content: Choose this hotel for its convenient location: Downtown, nestled between business towers and other, posher hotels, overlooking the Parc du Mont Royal. A walk of just minutes to the busy Ste. Catherine shopping area and the Metro to Old Montreal and other attractions. The hotel is also a quick walk to Crescent Street bars and a range of impressive restaurants. Although our room faced busy Rue Sherbrooke, it was quiet, though the windows did not open. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable place to stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: suzi d
Reviews.Content: Although it has been years since we stayed here, and mixed reports on this site, we were quite pleased with the room and service. Make sure to ask for a renovated room as they are apparently featuring photos of rooms with french doors that are the older accomodations. Simon was my sales contact who arranged the reservation and even phoned me, once we were settled, to make sure all was suitable. The parking is secure (under the building) and easy access via elevator. This is a super location for the hub of the city. The underground access is only one block away, if you want to avoid the weather and still find great shops - even Simons which is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Affordable, Spacious Accommadations”
Reviews.Author: PEIsland-Traveller
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal recently for meetings and spent 2 nights at Hotel Le Cantlie Suites, my first stay here. It is conveniently located, the rate was excellent and the generally positive reviews suggested it was worth a try. The entrance is interesting with the automatic doors (outer and inner). One set has to be fully closed before the other will open. It kept the lobby warm and no bursts of frigid air while registering but don't plan to be in a hurry coming or going. The staff was friendly, helpful and accommodating. The elevators are small and slow but I didn't spend any time waiting or being crowded. The hotel is/has been undergoing renovations. I was on a recently renovated floor. My room was upgraded to a king studio suite, a large room, very comfortable king bed with nice bedding, large windows with view of downtown, comfortable desk/workstation and sofa. There was a little nook kitchenette behind folding doors equipped with the basics, dishes, etc. Included was an older stove & fridge combo - worked perfectly, microwave and a sink. There was also a small table and chairs in the room and large, flat screen TV on a wall mounted arm to allow for viewing from the sitting area or bed, very convenient. The bathroom was smallish but clean and functional. I was disappointed with the room lighting, tended to be dark at night even with all lights on, not the best for reading. One of the sofa cushions was stained. And despite the renovations the room still appeared somewhat dated and tired. However it was spacious, clean and comfortable. I will stay again if the price stays reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: Ottawan
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our mid 60s. We stayed at this property one night in January 2012 while visiting relatives in Montreal. We arrived at the hotel around 9pm on a Saturday night and left at 9am the following morning. We used none of the hotel's facilities. The hotel is extremely well situated on chic Sherbrooke Street, in the heart of the downtown core. It is near everything in central Montreal. It is an excellent choice, if one is touring the city. Let me first set out the positive features of the property, then I will highlight the few negative aspects. The room was clean, and much to our surprise, had a full kitchen, including a full size fridge and stove + microwave oven. Our room had two double beds. They were memory-foam mattresses and were one of the most comfortable we've ever slept on. The bathroom was clean, and there were sufficient toiletries. On the negative side, the furniture and carpets were somewhat tired. Clearly, the entire hotel needs a renovation. The TV is not flat-screen, but rather a cathode ray picture. But, it is a large screen and it worked well. The bathroom needs sprucing up. The fixtures are old style. Clean, but old style! But, let me stress again that the hotel is very clean and neat. Parking was $20 plus tax for the night and it is valet parking, where one must surrender the car key to the attendant. I don't like that, but that is only a personal peeve. We had limited interactions with hotel staff. Check in was fast and pleasant, and staff were helpful. The clerk offered us information about Montreal, but as ex-Montrealers, we did not need a map, etc. We booked this hotel via booking.com and it was a special deal at $90 plus tax. At that price, we very much got our money's worth and I would not hesitate in returning to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great value downtown”
Reviews.Author: KWH70
Reviews.Content: Le Cantlie is a converted apartment building. It has huge rooms, with a small kitchenette in every suite. Great downtown location, at a very reasonable price. Their buffet breakfast is a bit pricey for what you get, but you can always have breakfast in your room with the kitchen. Overall, great value.

Reviews.Title: “From the 70`s - like a lot in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: Gold2004
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellenty located, close to both restaurants, McGill, shopping and transporation. The rooms are really old-fashioned, but as other reviewers have pointed out, the place is clean ! Still, a renovation would not be a bad idea, but then I guess the rates would change.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay with a "Retro like Experience" but not by design!”
Reviews.Author: aaronn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late November for 2 nights.... I booked one of the larger rooms with a pull out sofa and separate room with King Bed as additional friends were joining. The rooms were clean but very dated! The wallpaper and carpet is from the 70's but actually in decent shape considering they have not renovated. The location for this hotel is great and the staff were responsive. We got back to the room late and found no blankets or sheets were in the room for the sofa bed so we called down and they brought up fresh sheets/blankets very quickly. If you are not looking for a modern experience, I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for family stay in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: FCMR99
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice with the family (incl. two teenagers) over the past two years. Opted for suite with bedroom (2 doubles) separate from sitting area which has a fold out couch. Includes small (although dated) kitchenette. Location is my favourite in Montreal. Get a room facing the mountain for the view. Easy access to trails for a great afternoon walk up Mount Royal. Lots of very good restaurants and night clubs within quick walking distance. Minutes from Metro (subway), movie theatres and excellent shopping at Cours Mont Royal or along St. Catherines. Restaurant has a good breakfast although there are lots of much better choices for lunch and dinner nearby. Overall a bit dated but still clean and excelent value for downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: stockpicker_10
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms, kitchen was convenient. Staff was helpful. Location was perfect for us. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Great Location but...”
Reviews.Author: Greg_and_Bridget
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, great location right downtown. Rates were great for what we got, nice room, comfortable bed. Little kitchenette in the room which was nice but we didn't use it. Washroom was fine and very clean. Staff were nice. But...the rooms were quiet from the hallway but when someone ran the water in the room above you heard it.

Reviews.Title: “good value for price”
Reviews.Author: crinkie
Reviews.Content: Spent last weekend there for a conference. The room was clean. The bathroom fixtures are a little old, but everything is in order. The beds were extra comfortable with plump mattress cover and feather pillows. Underground parking with valet service (extra fee, 23$ per day. Average for the area) was greatly appreciated to forget about the car for the weekend (you can walk everywhere and you are close to a metro station). Front desk very helpful and polite. I really enjoyed my stay. I didn't go to the restaurant there, there are so many to choose from downtown! Walking distance to the art museum, Concordia and McGill universities and St-Catherine street (shopping).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: OntHiker
Reviews.Content: Booked through expedia.ca, the room rate was very reasonable. Spacious room, comfortable bed and furnishings and clean. The mini kitchenette was efficient and quite useful. No corkscrew but one call and Housekeeping quickly came to provide one. All staff were helpful and courteous. The location is very close to the Metro and a bus stop at the corner made it easy to get around the city. The mezzanine dining room was overpriced, food not the best. Ate there twice, for convenience only, during a 4 day stay. Overall a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “good deal, good location”
Reviews.Author: Asparagusto
Reviews.Content: Another successful Travelzoo deal. Great location on Sherbrooke street near Peel. Small kitchenette including a stove. It would be a great weekend getaway and Simons shopping close by! We paid for parking but if you time it right you can pay to park on the street until 6 PM and save some money. It's even walking distance to Duluth or Prince Arthur.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown Montreal location”
Reviews.Author: MichaelTorontoCanada
Reviews.Content: My wife and I grew up in Montreal so we know the city well. We selected the Cantlie as we travelled with our teenage children so we needed two rooms; we simply wanted very good value. We booked Le Cantlie Suites Hotel due to its prime downtown location (Sherbrooke & Peel is a central as you can get). It is walking distance to shopping, restaurants and museums. It's minutes away by taxi, bike or subway to just about anything else you'd want to see or do in Montreal. Staff and lobby are very nice. The rooms are spacious and very clean with new beds and bedding. The decor is dated but for the price and location, this place is an excellent choice. If you are looking for a deluxe fancy modern hotel then you might not be happy - but of course, you'll end up paying much more. Le Cantlie Suites Hotel is a solid choice and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: 01Jules1982
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel and it was just as expected, clean, comfortable and spacious rooms. The rooms were a bit dated but they did the job well, and it was a bonus to have a mini kitchenette inside what looked like a closet. My only complaint is that you can't open any windows and there are no balconies, but the outdoor pool/patio are was open, so we spent a fair amount of time up there! I would definitely recommend this hotel for a trip to Montreal, especially if you can find a deal like we did!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: mikmika_27
Reviews.Content: Had no issues with my stay, everything was great. The beds were extremely comfy, the parking was convenient. The room had a small kitchenette with complementary coffee and tea. The room was spacious and quiet. Wi-fi was not free, but there is a business center with first 30 minutes free. Helpful staff. The view from the rooftop pool was beautiful. It does need a slight renovation for the common areas and elevators, which were very slow. All in all, I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price”
Reviews.Author: LabMonkeyToronto
Reviews.Content: There are a wide variety of reviews about this place, so I was hesitant to book it for my trip to Montreal. I was going during a large conference, though, so I didn't have much choice as we booked pretty late. The hotel is in a good location, close to restaurants, McGill, and shopping if you are so inclined. The rooms are quite comfortable and spacious. My bed, a queen, was very comfy, with a pillow top and nice thick blankets. I was on the 10th floor facing Sherbrooke street, and I had no trouble sleeping (sound wasn't an issue). The breakfast was ok, but rather pricey for what you got at the buffet. Cora's is relatively close by so I recommend that instead. The only real negatives: there are only 3 elevators for 27-ish floors, so you may end up waiting a while. The key lock (yup it's an actual key, not a card) was a bit finicky at first, but once I got used to it it was fine. Movement in the halls can be a bit loud, but I went to bed pretty late each night so it wasn't much of an issue for me. The front desk was quite helpful, and ordered me a cab to the airport for early in the morning. I didn't get to try the pool or the gym, but apparently there is one of each here. All in all, a good comfortable stay at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and a fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ragnhild
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good place to stay when in Montreal. The view from the roof-top pool is wonderful! Had a large one-bedroom apartment, which was nice. Good kitchen, quite good bathroom, spacious living-room, good wardrobe-facilities, large TV, tea and coffee in the room. The breakfast was adequate, friendly staff both in breakfast-restaurant and in the reception. On the minus side, the hotel room I got seemed a little worn and needs some general maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good area, good stay!”
Reviews.Author: MLEMRT
Reviews.Content: We were headed to Montreal for a 4 day long weekend, with a toddler! So we required a "homebase", we needed a hotel room with a seperate bedroom so we could put the baby to bed and still have a life after 8pm. We also needed a kitchen since our little guy doesn't eat much at restaurants. After a lot of internet research, we decided on this hotel. We LOVED it. Spending the extra bucks for the one-bedroom suite was sooo worth it. The decor was outdated but the room was clean and we do believe it was bigger than our actual house! We had a seperate bedroom with 2 queen beds, a walk-in closet and a decent sized flat screen tv. The floor to ceiling windows had views to die for! Coming into the room the bathroom was on the left, it was your typical hotel restroom, nothing special, but very clean! Then walking past that, there were 2 double closets, then you walk into the living/dining room area to your right or open the door and go into the bedroom on your left. The dining room had a small dining room table with 4 chairs and a lamp. There was also a large closet-which SURPRISE was actually a kitchen! It was actually larger then we thought it would be. It had a full stove/oven, full sized fridge with freezer, sink, microwave, toaster, kettle, pot/pans, cutlery, china, glasses, can opener etc. Everything you would need! The living room was very large, with a pull out couch (which we never used) and an armoire with the smallest TV I had ever seen, possibly from 1982. (It seemed odd that the better TV was in the bedroom?) The TV was so small and old and dark we could not read the subtitles! Being in Quebec and not speaking french, this really sucked!!! The living room also had huge windows and a writing desk. The whole hotel had an Old Montreal feel, brass elevator included. We really liked the old school feel but if you are looking for modern, crisp style, this hotel is not for you. But we figured that since we were staying in Old Montreal, we should stay in a place like this. We really liked the location. It was close to shopping, bars, restaurants, subway, etc. The hotel has valet parking for $25 a day. Yes, pricey but we liked the easy access and the no worries parking. Driving/parking is crazy nuts so I would recommend leaving the car in the garage and walk! We really enjoyed the staff here. We were in the process of selling our house while travelling (not recommended) so I had to fax & email several documents over and over again as offers were coming in and countering back and the front desk staff were great. I know I must have been annoying but they were professional and friendly at all times. And best of all, everyone spoke English! I was expecting to have language issues, but we never did. I just learned to say "HELLO" before they said Bonjour, they would just switch right to English, no worries! Even the Valet guys were super helpful, giving directions and such. When looking at the pictures posted here on TA, our suite looked completely different, the kitchen was WAY bigger and more updated, so maybe you can requested a more updated room? We stayed in room 2006, its a good one! It was directly across the hall from the elevator but we never heard anything. We had excellent sleep, except the sheets and bedding were seriously starched or something, the sheets were crackily so everytime you moved, you made a lot of noise. With a baby in the room, any noise is bad noise! The room was easily baby-proofed and we loved that you could actually close the door on the kitchen and then the baby is safe, even when you are cooking. The old elevator takes FOREVER, if you are checking out during the "peak" hours, you could wait over 20 mins for an elevator. I was pissed as we stood there with a twitchy toddler and the elevator opened up filled with maids. Really? The maids are holding up the elevators while your guests are trying to check out? Time to update the elevators and/or get a service elevator!!! So in closing, we loved the old feel of the hotel, it was clean, the staff are nice and its a great location. We did not like the slow elevators and the small old TVS, but other than that, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, renovations required”
Reviews.Author: Mayan__PrincessTdot
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice location, close to Ste-Catherine's, restaurants, bars, shopping, etc. However, the decor is very outdated and the hotel definitely does not have any type of "wow-factor." If you are on a budget (and its not even THAT cheap) and looking for a clean place to sleep in a good location, then this is your hotel! The biggest issue? The elevators. They took absolutely forever and were tiny. No matter what language people were speaking, we were able to understand that people were complaining about the elevators each time we were in the lobby. Upon checking into our hotel, we had a couple of bags each and chose to bring them up to our room on our own. We waited for an elevator and one of the bell boys conveniently jumped in before us (with the big cart they use) and this took up more than half the elevator. It was blocking the door for us to enter also and he made no attempt to move it so that we could get into the elevator comfortably. Instead, we had to manoeuver around it (if we had been of larger size, we would have never squeezed by it.) Not the level of service I would expect at a hotel where we should be treated as guests. I would not recommend this hotel to friends, as there are many much nicer hotels in Montreal that really go the extra mile for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and simple, but good location and friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: Keith S
Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly staff, clean rooms, great location, quiet despite being on a very busy street in heart of the city. Cons: Dated rooms and facilities, manual key was annoying. Didn't really go above and beyond, felt a little "nickel and dimed" with small extra charges left and right. Valet service was terrible, didn't really provide any advantage over parking myself. Extended stay would be difficult with check in, as no person provided assistance. No service above and beyond service. Overall a good stay if you are looking for a bed and nothing more. No real service was provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Needs some upgrades..”
Reviews.Author: ovanesiani
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel for the weekend. I had received a great rate with travelzoo and most hotels in Montreal are not as cheap and some may think. I have been to Montreal many times but this was the first time here. I have to say the beds are AMAZING. I almost always have trouble sleeping in hotel beds but this is what made this hotel. It is clean I cannot say anything bad about that but it does need improvements. For example they still use a actual key for the doors. I know maybe this is the trademark but having to take that key around when going out was not fun. The hotel is downtown and there are so many places within a block or two radius where you can have drinks and eat and it is also close to the university. If someone is looking for a quiet hotel this is not it. It is on a busy street and if you drive here there is no parking. They have a lot that is $23/day. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: An0n56
Reviews.Content: Cantlie represents very good value and a great location (which for me meant close to McGill). Upon checking in I was delighted to learn that I had been given an upgrade to a one-bedroom suite; the accommodation was extremely spacious and very clean. It wasn't 5-star luxury, but it was absolutely fine. If you approach this hotel with an expectation of clean, comfortable accommodation at the right price and in a very convenient location, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very good working stay”
Reviews.Author: nameleftblank
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a work trip in Spring 2011. The room was huge, quiet, and comfortable. The decor is a bit old, but everything is clean well maintained. The location in downtown Montreal, across from McGill campus, is excellent for work. Great quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: “This was perfect for us.”
Reviews.Author: Cncrtjnky
Reviews.Content: I booked this room for four of us as we were going to Heavy MTL. We had a suite with a separate bedroom, with two beds and I had requested a cot. The cot was more comfortable than the sofa bed, but I slept in the bedroom where the beds were divine. I did not want to get out of bed in the mornings. With the kitchenette we were able to purchase food from a local grocery and make our own breakfasts to save money and time. We requested extra towels each day and it was not a problem. We were not the neatest but everyday we came back that room was immaculate. My niece and great-nephew went up to the roof top pool and they were very impressed, even took pictures to be able to show everyone at home. My nephew and I ate at the restaurant on our one free night, it was pricey but so very good. I think we ended up sampling most of the desserts as the other two joined us at the end of the meal. The staff was great all the way around and I was very happy with my decision to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Belze999
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff, clean, large rooms and nice view!

Reviews.Title: “WORST hotel experience ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: glcas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the worst i have ever been treated, they are rude, incompetent, and totally lacking in hospitality services. The services are terrible. The valet is not clearly indicated and the front desk evening receptionist is extremely rude...might i add she looked as though she would spit on us! After 30 minutes of arguing about the number of ppl allowed in...the biggest suite they have, we finally had to ask to speak with the manager who convieniently was out. 6 people in a suite is not exagerated! THERE ARE 3 BEDS!!!! she wanted to charge for 4 extra people when we had booked for 4 clearly knowing we would have to pay for 2 extra. She was in no way helpeful. The next morning we find ourselves in the same situation with the manager, very rude and very lacking in customer service!! Would not be in the least helpful even after showing him many different times our reservation papers and even pointing out how we reserved online, telling us to check with the website(?) instead of complainging to him THE HOTEL MANAGER!!!! after a very long and exhausting debate he finally and not willingly or gracisouly offered that we only pay 2 extras....duh thats what we were expecting!! not jumping thru hoops and receiving terrible service. The pool was old and dirty, the lounge chairs falling apart! The hotel does need alot of renovations, obviously not a priority. Very close to down town but for the pirce do reserve at the Rizt-Carlton,excellent service, execellent views, and excellent staff! It is right next door, Do not try this place out! You will be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Location was good but the rest was not”
Reviews.Author: Derek S
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and most of them said that the was hotel sub-par but the location was good. I looked past it as I usually do, but itâ€™s downfalls put a huge damper on our stay. We arrived a little after 11 pm and parked out front in the loading zone. Right away, out front sat a bunch of inebriated teenagers (the drinking age there is 18) who were making inappropriate remarks to our 12 year old daughter. That this hotel allows drunk people to loiter on their patio should have been a sign. I went inside to check in and the rude front desk lady said that the valet guy (parking is not free and is under the hotel) was still on duty to park the car. After ten minutes of unloading the car she rudely asked why I haven't given the keys to the valet and how he was waiting for us so that he could leave for the night. That was just the beginning of a series of negative events to unfold. Upon getting to our room (which faced an alley strewn with garbage and which said garbage was picked up at the crack of dawn with very loud trucks) we noticed our fridge was broken and we had two Queen beds. We specifically looked around for hotels with a king bed. The next morning we went down for the "continental breakfast" because any food we had was spoiled from the non-working fridge. After taking two bites, the waitress confirmed with us that we knew this was costing us money. What? She said yes there was a sign at the entrance to the restaurant. Well it was in French (as was the guest guide probably noting a cost for this breakfast) and it was turned the wrong way in an attempt in my opinion to somehow scam American's into purchasing things that are normally free. Not only was it not free, it was outrageously priced for what little variety of food there was. We complained with all the above nuisances and the front desk lady said that the breakfast was not included with the price of the room and apologized for the guest guide being only in French but would not comp the meal, that they choose two queen beds for us because they thought "that is what we would prefer", and that they would fix our fridge. They took it upon themselves to change our room preference thinking that is what we would've liked. The fridge was never fixed either. As a side note, the heated pool on the roof was in fact not heated and was cold even at the end of July. There is a key to get into the pool area but no one told us that nor was one provided at check in so we had to wait for someone to let us in. There were other minor problems such as a very slow and antiquated elevator system and on the second night there were cops in the lobby for hours going on about something with a guest. Yes the subway is one block away and yes Saint Catherine street is two blocks away but other than that this hotel provides little else. The concierge was not accommodating to any of our complaints, were quite rude and their apologies were half-baked at best. Stay somewhere else if I were you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PeggerinVan
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, a nice rooftop patio, super comfy beds and a fantastic location within walking distance from Mont Royal, Crescent Street and St Catherine's. Would definitely stay again! If only it had an airport shuttle!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good!”
Reviews.Author: 7tocs7
Reviews.Content: Stayed in May of 2011. The room (as with other reviews I got an actual metal key) was nice. Although they were renovating the room across the hall so there was some noise. It didn't bother me as I was really just there to sleep so aside from some early morning noise (8:30 a.m. ish) it was alright. The bathroom was a good size and the water pressure in the shower was killer - as in heavy and good. Almost too heavy if there is such a thing lol. Had a mini kitchen available when you opened a set of doors, worked just fine. Other than the reno going on across the hall I have no complaints and that never really bothered me that much anyway. Note: I got a good deal on this hotel...about $115 a night, I've seen it go for close to $200 a night so consider that in my ratings.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToGetAway-TOGal
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel and the suite was huge. Yes, the hotel is a little tired, but for the price, we were more than pleased. The Luxurious One Bedroom suite was perfect for our needs and we were delighted with how spacious it was. Internet at $5 per day wasn't too steep and the roof-top pool was a welcome escape from the summer heat. All in all a very nice stay and the staff were extremely polite and helpful. I'd definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed!”
Reviews.Author: MelG9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel and were quite surprised by the service we received. When we arrived, we were given our room key to only find out that someone else had already been assigned that room. There was actually someone else in our room when we opened the door. I have never had such an experience in all my life. When we went went back down to the front desk, the receptionist did not believe this and sent a security guard with us to the room to see if what we were telling was true. I thought this to be insulting as who could come up with such a story and would want to at the time of night this all happened (12 a.m.). When the security guard saw what we did, a person in our assigned hotel room, he told the front desk. We were told that we could have a free upgrade for all of the confusion but then was soon told that we could not have the free upgrade as there was another room available similar to the one we had booked. We finally just gave up and took the room as we were both exhausted at this point and just wanted to sleep. I would not recommend this hotel. Mistakes happen but the way it was handled was not very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “First time won't be our last one”
Reviews.Author: laredo92
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel solely from online pics and other reviews since many of our usual Montreal hotels were booked for either the Rogers Cup (our reason for going) or the city's annual gay pride festivities. We booked a queen-bed studio but ended up with a king-bed studio, and it was great. Sure the hotel is older, but it's clean, the staff are helpful and very friendly, and we didn't expect it, but the room had a kitchenette which made it so we could be less reliant on always trying to find a restaurant for all meals. Location is only one block from the great Montreal metro system, and there were plenty of shops and restaurants within a 3 block radius if that's as far as you were willing to venture. We recommend this to any reasonable traveller (the fussy perfectionists should look elsewhere and expect to spend triple what we did) ENJOY!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't overlook this place. A terrific stay!”
Reviews.Author: GBorbs
Reviews.Content: Plenty of options in downtown Montreal, but I would have to say this one has to rank up there with some of the more familiar names. Spent four night here, there wasn't one thing any of us would change about the place. Downtown location was perfect, only a block or so to the Metro. Had a room facing the street (with a view of Mount Royal and nearby McGill U.) but street noise was never an issue. Staff was cheerful and attentive, all spoke English fluently, from the front desk to the cleaning staff. Rooms were spacious and clean, our executive suite had a kitchenette stocked with dishes, utensils, etc. plus a good-size fridge. Water pressure in the shower was top-notch. WiFi was easy to access and speed was good. Rooptop pool was clean and never too crowded while we were there, even with temps in the 80s. Some beautiful views of the city from up there, and more than enough lounge chairs. Parking valet was prompt and courteous. A wonderful, trouble-free stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good deal”
Reviews.Author: MarinaMay
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right downtown, in the midst of fashion, finance, some good restaurants, McGill and Mount Royal. It was easy to get to other sites by subway. The lobby is very attractive, the rooms large and comfortable. Appreciate a bathroom with plenty of counter space and a full size hair dryer. Also appreciate the mini-kitchen with fridge, coffee maker & micro plus dishes etc. The pool on the roof is a nice break (in summer). My only complaints were the noisy plumbing and difficulty adjusting the water temperature. Housekeeping did not always replace towels & used toiletries. If you are budgeting, it helps to know lower price shops & restaurants are available in the McGill underground mall.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Jwilly111
Reviews.Content: Great 3 star hotel, in a sweet location, minutes from St Catharines by walking and a short walk to McGill university. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased - would recommend and stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Fittfreak
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Le Cantlie Suites the first week of August and we were so pleasantly surprised on how great it was. We booked our stay via a Travel Zoo promotion and thought it was perfect! We were travelling with our kids - 10 and 13 years old - and stayed in a room with 2 queen beds and a gallery type of kitchen (it was the only hotel in our bracket with queen beds as opposed to double beds); the kitchen is also great to keep drinks and snacks for the kids. We walked straight from the train station to the hotel which took less than 10 min; it's in a perfect location - close to everything. Every single person that worked for the hotel was pleasant, polite and always wore a smile - the service at the restaurant where we had breakfast was exceptional. Yes, the place is a bit old (I believe it was an apartment turned into a hotel) but the rooms are nice and clean. The bed linens are crisp white sheets and duvets. The minor details I may criticize is the elevators are a bit slow (we climbed the stairs a few times to the 14th floor - which is great exercise sometimes after a big meal) and the water in our shower was a bit difficult to manage (really hot or real cold). Otherwise, if you ask my kids who believe in great customer service and a swimming pool for fun - we all loved it and would definitely stay again. For this price point - you get more than what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel. The only good thing is location.”
Reviews.Author: Kimbrat
Reviews.Content: I'm a fairly avid traveller... And have experienced my fair share of hotels. While I was jot expecting the ritz... This hotel is simply terrible. The check in experience took forever. Staff were snobbish. The rooms are mediocre at best. Elevators take forever. The locks on the doors are outdated. They do not include breakfast ( which is now standard at most hotels). Checkout experience was a gongshow... They stop to check the room before you're allowed to leave... Accused us of smoking in it and tried to charge us more!!!! Which is totally and completely untrue. Can u believe that! Im not sure about the bedbug claims but my arms do feel like they have bites on them this morning... Which suppose could be mosquitos. Will NEVER stay here again. Beware.... Stay far away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, affordable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MustangJoe
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Le Cantlie Suites Hotel while attending the Just for Laughs festival. I was a little concerned because the price I came up with was quite a bit less than other hotels in the area so I thought there must be something wrong it. This wasn't the case. Our room was large and clean and the location was great. The hotel does show some wear and tear and could use some sprucing up in places but overall, it's fine. The beds were very comfortable and the room was quiet. There is valet parking available for $23 per day which is under the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for the money for top location in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: gasptoronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel, which on the outside looks to be one of the finest examples of 70s moderne - concrete et all, is kitty corner to Sofitel & Best Western at the corner of Sherbroke & Peel. It's also happens to be One of the best locations to stay in Montreal, for business or pleasure. The rooms are large, clean & the beds are comfortable with updated linens. The in room internet is $ 5 per day. There is also a business centre wirh free Internet, a roof top pool (large enough to please most kids), on premise restaurant that serves lovely breakfast & a very swanky sushi joint attached to the hotel that enjoys a patio for dining al fresco. It's not cheap but serves very good, fresh & artfully presented cousine Japonaise. Good sushi is a rarity in Montreal, so if you hanker for a piece of raw fatty salmon belly, or seaweed salad, make sure you visit this place. The hotel is reasonably prices, esp if you book ahead. Like most n hospitality industry, they raise prices depending on what's going on in Montreal. I've paid $ 99 for one night in May, and $ 149 for 2 nights, with rate going up to $ 249 for the other two nights during the same visit in July because if the Divercite Festival. ROom

Reviews.Title: “A great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: lysander-nh
Reviews.Content: we stayed in one of the 2 room suites for the 5 of us (2 double beds + a pull out couch), plus kitchen and 4 person table. Very comfortable. Perfectly clean hotel. Charming little restaurant with very accomodating bartender for late afternoon break. The location is terrific- walking to Mont Royal, St Catherine shopping, the basilica, McGill neighborhood, subway right around the corner. I would recommend this as a budget-friendly but not dumpy place. The pool area is on the roof- beware- bring your own towels up there as it is bare bones. When we were there it was a weekend and it was party central with lots of drinking and smoking 20 somethings- so my kids were not into it- but if it were a calmer scene I could see hanging out there a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for fun trips”
Reviews.Author: flandaz
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Cantlie is in a very very convenient location in downtown Montreal. less than 5 minute walk to Ste Catherine street right in the heart of the best shopping area, and 1 minute walk to the Peel Subway Station. The hotel itself is nice enough, sure the wallpaper is dated but the bed is comfy and the room is clean. The bathroom was nice, clean and the shower had great pressure. There was a cute kitchenette in our room, complete with full fridge and stove, microwave, pots and pans and cutlery. Nice! The rooftop pool is the highlight! What an amazing view! The pool is set in a wooden balcony. We didn't try out the restaurant or bar, but they did have a Happy Hour where the beers were super cheap. The negative is that it does seem like a party hotel. It wasn't a holiday long weekend, but it felt like one! The walls are fairly thin and people are noisy, lots of university people in Montreal ready to party. I didn't mind as the noise was pretty minimal by the time we got back in at night so in the end it didn't disturb my sleep. The pool got annoying during the daytime when some of our drunken neighbours showed up but the mornings are nice and quiet. There is a fitness centre but we didn't get a chance to check it out. If you want a nice clean hotel, friendly service, great rooftop pool, great locations, and are okay that it could be noisy at times, Le Cantlie is a great choice for you

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: jayno19
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at Cantlie Suites a few years ago with a boyfriend, and my experience was quite pleasant. This is time around...it was much different. Everything went smoothly when we arrived. Check in was quick, they stored our luggage as we were early, we came back at four and were given the keys to our room. The rooms and hallways are quite dated now, and the cleaning maids leave garbage bags all over the halls when they are cleaning the rooms. There are little kitchen's in all of the rooms, which is a plus, however when my friend went under the bed to plug in the microwave...she found a Condom. We called the maid service and someone came up to retrieve it. We did not hear a word from the hotel after that. Not an apology, a free breakfast...NOTHING. We paid a hundred dollars a night, and were therefore not expecting the Ritz...however we did expect some level of professionalism. The location of this hotel is great. On Sherbrooke, between Stanley and Peel, 2 blocks from St. Catherineâ€™s. That's really about the only thing this hotel has going for it anymore. The breakfast is very expensive. You have to wait about 20 mins for an elevator. Check out is a disaster. I won't be staying at Cantlie again.

Reviews.Title: “surpassed all our expectations based on a friend experience”
Reviews.Author: salmonangler
Reviews.Content: Parking, front desk staff, room, beds, restaurant surpassed our expectations. We have stayed in many Montreal hotesl but never this one. We will be back -last but not least ~the location is ideal in downtown and the room rate is unbeatable

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gmalyova
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 4 girls for a bachelorette party. first the room was supposed to be a mini suite and it was smaller than a regular hotel room. second it smelled like 20 people had been smoking non stop in the room (non-smoking room requested). when we complained they told us we were wrong and nothing they can do. then one of the beds broke (guy came in and fixed it). the air wasn't working and windows didn't open, we had to open the door to get some air in because it was so hot in the room. Also the staff was rude. Terrible hotel, don't bother staying there...

Reviews.Title: “there is better for the price”
Reviews.Author: Kimchee80
Reviews.Content: Ill keep it short. bed was comfy. tv was really small. my robe had a huge brown stain on it. front desk staff were very rude. rooftop pool was ok. hotel bartender was slow and rude. vallet parkers were awesome. for 180/night i should have stayed at le germaine. not impressed and will NEVER go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “You can never go wrong with Le Cantlie”
Reviews.Author: KittensFever
Reviews.Content: I travel to Montreal at least eight times a year and every time I do, the first thing I check is the price and availability for Le Cantlie. Typically, you can score it on Expedia or Travelocity for anywhere between $85 - $125, given the season and time of booking. This hotel is all about location. Located on Rue Sherbrooke (between Peel and Stanley), you will find this hotel in a super clean, quiet and picturesque area of the city. Just two blocks above the hustle and bustle of Saint Catherine street. It is walking distance to many fabulous restaurants and shops. Across the street from a museum and Mt Royal. Another great thing about this hotel is the old style European charm. Wait till you see the dÃ©cor, it is old world chic. By no means does this mean the hotel is old and out of shape, in fact it is quite the opposite. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are exquisite. We had two double rooms closed in by white French doors that led into a little living room area, complete with full kitchenette (hidden behind closet doors) table, chairs and couch. Great room for the price! If youâ€™re looking for something with modern dÃ©cor, this is not it. Iâ€™ve never tried the restaurant (stayed at le Cantlie a dozen times, but itâ€™s surrounded by great restaurants so why would one stay inside the hotel?) but the bar area is great. There is also a rooftop pool that is great fun, when it is open. I visited once in September and it was still open. From there, you can see the entire city â€“ the hotel is 30 floors high after all. There are so many great things to do and see in Montreal. Make sure to make a trip to the old Montreal area, by the port (only a ten minute drive or so). You can take a cab ride and it will be cheap. This area is fabulous! Totally feels like youâ€™re in Europe. Here, many of the cobblestone streets are closed to car traffic and pedestrian only. In the warmer months, the restaurant patios are open with hosts beckoning for patrons to come in and try their fare. Lots of fabulous cafes line the streets. Horse carriage rides, art in the street, beautiful cathedrals. You name it, Montrealâ€™s got it. And of course, you got to watch a Habs game. Go Canadiens! The Bell Centre arena is electric.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Janspar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite on the 19th floor. The room was extremely spacious. 3 closets, small bathroom, large bedroom with 2 queen beds, large living room, dining area for 4 and a pretty big kitchen with a full size fridge , stove and microwave. The room was very clean and the fount desk staff were very kind and helpful no matter what time of day we stopped by for information. The hotel was quiet as well - there were many weddings going on that weekend and we could see a fair number of beverages being transported in the elevator so we were a bit worried but we didn't hear a thing and we were right by the elevators. The hotel is close to museums, shopping and many restaurants. It is about 3 blocks from McGill University and a 30 to 40 minute walk to old Montreal - a very interesting walk with many sites along the way - Churches and more shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: sarah1207
Reviews.Content: Myself and my two sisters stayed at this hotel for one night. We went up to Montreal for a concert at the Belle Center. This hotel was within 10 minutes, walking from the Belle Center which was great because the traffic was nuts. We were pleased with the price of the room and thought it was much more reasonably priced then some of the American chain hotels in the same location. The room size was great, we had two queen beds, a small refridgerator and microwave. There was plenty of additional space in the room if you had a lot of luggage. Everything was clean, and the bedding, including the matress seemed new and in great condition. The bathroom was a little small, but good enough for one night. They also had valet parking for $23 which we were willing to pay it to have some piece of mind about my car being safe (the parking was in a garage, not in an open lot). Overall we liked the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very poor excuse for a quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: seaeze
Reviews.Content: My familiy was planning to go to Montreal for a family function, and my sister had seen this hotel and wanted to stay there. Thus, I made reservations for everyone at this hotel, against my better judgement. The room looked good, and the two beds were comfortable; however, the hotel goes downhill from here. We were made to take a more expensive room, since we had 3 adults and 2 children in one room. The third adult had to sleep on the hideabed, which was extremely uncomfortable. The mattress was so thin, that you couldn't really call it a mattress. After complaining to the manager, it was replaced with a regular mattress, which was fine for us. During our first night, we were awoken at 1:00AM by a fire alarm. We all evacuated our room, which is what you should do when the fire alarm goes off in a hotel, and the main desk doesn't make a general announcement that it was not necessary. When we got to the main foor, we found out that an SUV had hit a fire sprinkler pipe in the basement garage, and caused the sprinklers to go off. The front desk should have made a general announcement that there was no need to leave your room; however, I feel that this would be asking too much from the staff at le Cantlie Suites Hotel. I was later told that it was the SUV driver's fault that this all happened, since there were signs in the garage that you can't park SUVs at the lower levels. When we checked into the hotel, I was told that ONLY the valets could park cars in the garage. However, as I later found out, since the valets don't work late at night, you have to park your own car/SUV at that time, which is high risk, since, at that time, people are tired and more accident-prone. We needed more coffee packets in our room, and I called the front desk to get some. I was told that they would send some up to our room. No coffee arrived, and a few hours later I called down again and was told that they would send some up. Of course, it didn't happen again. I called down a third time and when I mentioned my problem to the person answering the phone, she didn't even respond. But this time, I finally got the much awaited coffee packets. The next day, wnen I noticed that we didn't get a sufficient number of bath and hand towels from the cleaning staff, I called the front desk, and was told told that they would be sent up immediately. When the person arrived with the towels, he only had bath towels and told me that was all he was told to bring us. I then called the front desk once more and the finally got us the rest of our towels. This was probably the worst hotel stay that I have had in the past decade. I would highly recommend that you stay in one of the many fine hotels in Montreal, where you would be provided with the service and amenities that come with a fine hotel. This hotel is far from inexpensive, and I don't feel that you get your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality, Great price!”
Reviews.Author: MV2011
Reviews.Content: I had to travel to Montreal for business. My secretary booked the Cantlie suites because the deal was awesome. I didn't know what to expect and I was pleasantly surprised! Awesome surroundings and great staff. Hotel is central, you can walk everywhere. Underground shopping, museums, transportation, restaurants and more. Rooms were clean, bright, beautiful, and had the MOST comfortable beds. The room also had a small kitchen which a fridge, stove, microwave and coffeemaker. Staff very professional, friendly, helpful and provided great service. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean comfy beds with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Chrizzo
Reviews.Content: Went there for a bachelors party and was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. The hotel is situated close to all the "hot spots" in Montreal. St Catherines was just a block away and from there you can get almost anywhere you want. There was a metro station (Peel?) just around the corner for those who do not prefer to walk. The hotel staff was very helpful in answering our questions. I really liked that they offered a business centre (internet, printer ) on the 26th floor for the guests at no charge.Just ask the front desk for the key. We had two rooms on the 12th floor and both were large and clean. We didn't even know they had a kitchen until we opened one of the doors thinking it was a closet. They also have an awesome noon check out time which is very rare from my experience. The only complaint I heard from some of the guys was the shower was not that powerful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: d3e
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last July & had a great time. The hotel itself is right downtown & close to everything. Our suite had a 2 queen beds, lots of storage space & even a small kitchen. The downside was that the bathroom was so small. Super difficult with 4 women in one room! The rooftop pool was great too. Overall, great value.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Azadkavoosi
Reviews.Content: The hotel wireless system is so slow that even you can not brows a page and you should pay 5$ a day for this. Besides the fridge do not work well as all of my icecreem were melt there. The gym has really no equipment to do a good workout. Just cardio.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Marites8
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews, we were getting worried that it was a mistake we booked 2 rooms at this hotel might be a mistake. Boy! we were pleasantly surprised! Gorgeous surroundings and great service staff. Hotel is near everything...underground shopping, Montreal Museum of Fine Arts, other museums, subways, quaint sights, restaurants and more. You can simply park your car and walk everywhere. They had 2 restaurants on sight but they did not look appealing so venture out. Ended up at Fire Grill and glad we did - it was great! La Campina was another one but it looked like they had a dress code. Rooms 1408 & 1409 were clean, bright, beautiful, and had the most comfortable beds. The room also had a quaint kitchen which a fridge, stove, microwave, utensils and coffeemaker. Had breakfast the next day in their Mezzanine. Food was simple nothing fancy and it was pricey but we were so tired we ended up having breakfast at this hotel. We parked our car here and it was expensive (best to park it across the street for less $). Outdoor swimming pool only available in the summer-too bad they don't have an indoor pool. Staff very professional, friendly, helpful, accommodating and provided great service. We will go back again and longer!

Reviews.Title: “In a sea of Big Chain Hotels, this standalone tops them all!”
Reviews.Author: Ta10p
Reviews.Content: We arrived a few hours before check in and they offered to store our luggage until room was ready. I had requested an accessible room for my bride(wheelchair sometimes) and they moved heaven and earth; got us in a room(suite) within minutes. What a perfect suite (22nd fl)! Old world charm and decor to match! It felt a lot like we were at the Grand hotel de Lourdes in Lourdes, France! Parking is a bit steep but not out of line with other world cities. Stay away from restaurants except for a drink($$$). Many other choices within a few blocks. Staff is fantastic and could teach manners to many. Too bad rooftop pool is closed out of season. Wonderful experience thanks to Monsieur Nicolas and other gentlemen, Mesdemoiselles Sophie, Karine, Melanie, sorry I forgot a few names! Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Check to see if hotel is still under construction!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bikerscum64
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find the whole hotel was surrounded by construction mesh,it was @ 6:30 pm so no noise,the reason we came to Montreal was 4 a couple of hockey games and the night life,which both were great.We arrived on a weds night and went out and partied all night,,arrived back at hotel around 5am only to be awaken @ 8:30am by the sounds of jackhammering on the balcony above are room this continue for 2 more days,we were told after requesting a new room that the whole hotel was under reno's n because it was Friday that there was no reno's on the weekend so we stayed put.What i am most disappointed with is because our flight did not leave until 6:30pm on Sunday night we requested late check-out at 5:00pm when we got to the front desk they had the gaul to charge us $85.00!!!!!! In all my travels i have never had such a bad experience oh and not to mention my traveling partner go the bed with the bedbugs i would not reccomend this hotel unless you r desperate and there wasn't a garbage can to stay in on some dark alley in old Montreal!!!!! P.S the city of Montreal rocked this hotel sucked!!!!!!!!!! going back soon. Donald Stanley Vancouver B.C

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: ncmario
Reviews.Content: The location is great (nearby access to Metro, downtown, & restaurants). The rooms are spacious with ktichenettes - stove & frig. Beds are comfortable. Lobby is modest. Service desk very helpful. The Cantlie is an outstanding value for nthe room size, kitchenette, beds, and location - all at a reasonable price. If the hotel were new with an expansive lobby, etc. the price would be in the 4-5 star hotel range. One of the best values for hotel rooms I have seen. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “decent place”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Silva
Reviews.Content: I lost counts on the number of times I stayed in this hotel. It is a bit old, but It is nicely located. The price is decent and it is clean. I travel once a month to Montreal, so when the better hotels are too expensive or when I decide to book in the last minute, I stay in here. They have nice beds, and small kitchens. Not a place I would go with my husband, but when you are in a business trip all that you need is a comfortable bed and wireless internet (which is extra-per day). I stayed once in the summer and I went to their roof top swimming pool (what a view)!!!

Reviews.Title: “The bed was the best part of this hotel stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mikesgurl
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice for a long weekend mini vacation. The bed was very plush and comfortable with down dovet covers and feather pillows. Just like home! The staff were helpful and friendly. I have to recommend a restaurant on Peel that was wonderful. The Universal Restaurant is a must. We ate there a few times. Really great food and excellent service. The Metro is on Peel one block down and the entrance to the underground mall is two blocks south on Peel. This hotel is dated, currently being renovated externally, and needs alot of TLC.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: CarrieT
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and really enjoyed this hotel. Having a small kitchen came in very handy - not being a big breakfast eater, we were able to eat a light breakfast in our room. Lots of good restaurants nearby, and it was a short walk to the tourist info centre. The room was clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie777Toronto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the centre of Montreal's shopping district and is close to the metro. The suites had its own kitchenette which includes a microwave, toaster and some cutlery/plates/bowls. We stayed at two different rooms in this hotel through our trip and although we paid the same price, the rooms were fairly different, one was more modern looking, had 1 bed and a sofa bed but didn't have a stove and the other had a stove and 2 king beds but more outdated look. The buffet breakfast (included in our package) was nice, had sausages, bacon, scrambled eggs, french toast, potatoes, baked goods, cereals and fruits.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but that is it!”
Reviews.Author: Victorians2010_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 days at the hotel. We picked that hotel because of our long stay we wanted to be comfortable. The hotel was way more expensive than many others available. It provides sort of a seperate living room and a small kitchen very badly equiped, everything is old and falling apart. This allows the hotel to label their room as "suites" and claim the extra $$$. The bathroom is 1960 style with not updates, there is definetly a problem with the plumbing, after a shower you can swim in the tub and the towells provided are awful. I don't think that the place has been painted in the last 20 years. All the accessories/equipment in the room are so badly abused (ironing board, iron, hair dryer etc) , you do not feel like using them. The bed is nice and comfortable, but for the price we paied when we were there you can get a lot of truly higher end hotel. We were in Toronto for a long stay and lived in Cambridge Suites Hotel. Very similar $$$$ but felt a lot better about the hotel. I recommend Cambridge but do not recommend Cantlie. The extra you are paying for the suite is not worth it. One more thing, they have a restaurant, the service is awful! Absolutely awful!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in the heart of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Habsfan80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is vey well located, just two blocks from famous Rue St. Catherine and a 5 minutes walk from the Bell Center. The staff was very friendly and gave us a two bed room with an extra sofa bed since we were three friends together. The room was very spacious, not very modern but clean and also the bathroom was OK. There is also parking opportunity in the hotel but not free of charge. The surrounding area is good for shopping, dining and also for going out. Rue Crescent with all it's bars and irish pubs is also in walking distance. Also McGill is close and you can walk to the Mont Royal. The nearest Metro Station is "Peel". I would highlight the spacious rooms and the friendly staff in Le Cantlie Suites. I would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, well-maintained 70s era modern suites hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLorimer
Reviews.Content: The Cantlie is a throwback to a time when hotel designers thought that a suites hotel should come with a reasonable amount of floor space, something close to a full kitchen, and a workable living area -- as well as a reasonable sized bedroom. The desk personnel at the Cantlie couldn't tell me when it was built, but my guess in the 70s. The floor plate is modest, but the hotel rises high above the street, and every suite has a concrete balcony. There are generous windows, so very good daylight. The kitchens include a real oven, plus stovetop, plus fridge, with tableware, all in an alcove. The bathrooms are not large, and don't include a control valve on the hot and cold, but they are consistent with the era. Located right across from the Sofitel, on Sherbrooke Street just west of McGill, the neighbourhood offers a range of restaurant options as well as shopping, art galleries, and proximity to all kinds of facilities. The bed was pillow top, very comfortable, with a duvet style cover and fine cotton sheets. No scrimping there. The Cantlie is a trip back in time, well preserved and maintained, and distinct from run of the mill three star properties. Its proprieters deserve credit for sticking with the original formula, and maintaining it as well as they have.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for price.”
Reviews.Author: nytraveler0910
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location only 2 blocks from the Peel Metro station and the shops on St. Catherine Street. It is within walking distance of the underground shops and foodcourts where you can grab a quick bite. If you like walking you can walk to Old Montreal. Also located very close to the offices of downtown Montreal. Room was quite spacious and bed was comfortable. The room also had a small closet kitchenette with a small refrigerator which I used to store some juice. Only downside was the TV was very small and the cleaning staff could be better trained. I dropped some crumbs on the floor and they were still there 2 days later. Also, when towels were removed they sometimes were not replaced. I used a wash cloth and shower cap and when it was removed they did not replace it. Also, made a cup of tea and the tea was not replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Better places elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: newman63
Reviews.Content: This place is dated, musty, and can use a major refurb. On top of that, the staff really didn't seem all that concerned when we were kept up most of the night by bachelor party revelers. Location is great, but for this price, it should gut renovate and improve service.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Cantlie Suites”
Reviews.Author: saintsfan11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cantlie Suites hotel for one night with my 2 grandchildren ages 10 and 12. I had a king suite with a king bed in a room with french doors and a fold out queen sofa. I phoned the hotel directly and asked about any specials and they said they would match any price I found on the internet that could be verified. We arrived at the hotel at about 11:30 am. There is no drive around entrance to the hotel, so you have to park/stop on Sherbrooke or Peel - not easy, but I found a semi legal parking space and puit my 4-ways on. My room was ready when I arrived which was great. We went up right away and stowed our stuff. The room was very clean, the king bed was very comfy with a lovely white duvet and good pillows. We asked to have the fold out bed made up and left for most of the day. The only negative was that I didn't ask for a non-smoking room, as I assumed hotel rooms usually are non-smoking. There was a smell of cigar when you opened the room, but after a minute in the room, it wasn't noticable. The front desk staff were very pleasant and when we returned at about 4 pm, the sofa bed was made up. The valet parking staff were also very pleasant and helpful. I had to retrieve a few things from the car and they were very nice. The hotel is very convenient to the metro and taxis are always close by. For this hotel I would say the pluses are its great location, friendly staff and reasonable price. The hotel could do with some updating - especially the pool which is painted concrete and very utilitarian looking. The views of Montreal from the rooftop are great The bathroom was small, as noted in other reviews and the TV is small and older, but it worked just fine. The fridge and AC are not noisy which was good as the sofa bed is near the AC fan. We noticed that the room had a small balcony which couldn't be accessed as all windows etc were caulked and painted shut. Too bad! Overall we enjoyed our stay and wouldn't hesitate to return, but would make sure to ask for a non-smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better!”
Reviews.Author: Martini1BostonMA
Reviews.Content: The location is OK, but after really exploring Montreal I think we'd stay in the Mont Royal section: really fun restaurants, bookstores, shopping, etc. definitely funkier: rue St. Catherine is kind of gross, to be honest. The one word that kept coming up when we summed up the Cantlie was "grubby." The lobby is sad, the elevators tiny and cramped, usually many people waiting for them. the carpeting is sad and tired, the cement pavers in front need a serious hosing down. We ARE NOT picky, either. We had a suite, it was OK but really, the toilet ran all night, the shower drain was clogged and it was just kind of sad and unkempt as a whole. The one caveat was that we really found the staff nice and helpful but all agreed we wouldn't stay there again, hotel.com deal or not.

Reviews.Title: “great location - crappy hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: InternationalCalgary
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights and would never go back. The only positive is that the Hotel is situated in a great location. Front desk staff were as poor as they come. Terrible customer service. Rooms although have been upgraded are small and noisy noisy In fact until 4:30 am you could hear people coming and going with door slamming down the hallway. You can do much better in Montreal. Beware!!!

Reviews.Title: “service, service, service”
Reviews.Author: famtimeOntario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Cantlie as a result of a Travelzoo promotion and were most impressed. From the valets in the parking garage to the front desk clerks, all seemed genuinely interested is assisting us throughout our stay. All were courteous and knowledgeable about the area and readily shared their information. The room was clean, quiet and had all the amenities we required. The location was ideal and close to restaurants, mÃ©tro stations and shopping. In a busy bustling city such as MontrÃ©al, it is refreshing to see this level of service. It was our first stay at Le Cantlie and most certainly not our last!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: BJB413
Reviews.Content: This hotel is showing its age. Had to call for towels and washclothes 3 times. Remote didn't work. Bottom of toilet was not clean. Bed linen was fresh. The TV was small. Could not leave a tip for bad service. Should have stayed at the Sofitel across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs renovation and horrible Internet!”
Reviews.Author: caesar52
Reviews.Content: We paid a premium to stay here during Grand Prix weekend. The good points about this hotel is the location formost. Right by Mont Royal walkway, metro, and all kinds of shops and restaurants. It is just a couple blocks from the Ritz-Carlton and across from the Sofitel. Bed was super comfortable and the suite with French doors leading to the bed was charming and spacious. Full kitchen was convenient. Now for the negatives: decor and hotel in general is dated and needs to be fully renovated. The bathroom was extremely cramped and can only have one person in it at a time and even then is a tight fit. The hotel uses regular keys on a large card which is not only inconvenient to carry but can pose a security issue. Gym and pool facilities were unimpressive although there were nice views form the rooftop. Now to the biggest issue of all, the Internet! Not only was it not free, but it didn't work probably 75% of the time! Wifi would connect but would time out often and could take over 5 minutes to load a single page. It would work sporadically but over the course of 4 days the issue persisted. It would take 30 minutes to do what could normally be done in 15. If you are a businessperson do not stay here! Even just for leisure it was a huge inconvenience beacuse we were trying to look up maps, directions, and restaurant reviews. At checkout this was mentioned to the front desk and they were no help at all, didn't apologize or offer to take all or some of the Internet bill off. I would only stay here if you can get a really good deal, don't mind dated old decor, and don't need to use the Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay”
Reviews.Author: fanofearl
Reviews.Content: We have been to Montreal many times, and never found 'the place to stay' - until now. This hotel was a great value and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our room had a kitchen which we really appreciated and we also enjoyed the American breakfast buffet each morning. Our room was clean and quiet. The location was also very handy for walking. I've always found that parking is pretty pricey in Montreal ($32 / day at this hotel), but the valets were very pleasant and efficient. There is a lot of road work in the area at the time we were there, so the fact that we didn't have to drive and could instead walk or take the metro was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Suite, Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: ETCMH77
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Le Cantlie; the first was a solo stay, and this time, I stayed there with my partner, for a week. We booked an executive suite, and it was exactly as described--sleeping area separated by French doors from a nice living area, kitchenette, and small bathroom. the furnishings were a bit dated but well maintained, and the bedding was extremely comfortable. Plenty of closet and drawer space for a week's stay. The room was on the 25th floor and faced south, so we had a great view. We were also in the middle of a heat wave and very much appreciated the great air conditioning--something we did not find in a lot of Montreal locations. Staff was very helpful, especially with directions and transportation. i do wish they upgraded their exercise room with better equipment, but it looks like they are about to do just that. The hotel itself is a bit dated, but they keep it very well maintained, and we regularly saw maintenance staff around the property. The best part about the hotel is the location--a block from the Peel St. Metro, less than a block from a Bixi bike stand, and walking distance to Maisonneuve and Ste. Catherine shopping. I would absolutely stay there again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Guzilla
Reviews.Content: The only slight complaint I could have about the hotel is that the rooms are in need of a makeover. The price was good, the room was large and comfortable, the pool is great, but the decor seems to have been bought sometime in the 80s. But that's a petty complaint, really. Everything was clean and well-kept. And I was astounded that they still have actual keys instead of the credit card things.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star stay and Location at Two Star Rates!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dougs211
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, great staff, great facilities at a great price. We would recommend this hotel to liesure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A Romance Spoiler”
Reviews.Author: rickst_10
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a romantic weekend getaway based on the information the hotel provided on their website. After we arrived to our room we found that we were not placed into the type of suite we booked, but into a different one - much cheaper and simpler. After we complained at the reception desk, we were told that they do not guarantee the accommodation type, but only the price. Even though we paid for a one bedroom suite, they placed us into a studio "suite" that had nothing to do with a suite. It was a rather uninviting uncomfortable room with seriously outdated furnishings and bedding, some kitchen appliances tacked into a small closet and a tiny uncomfortable bathroom. A coffeemaker was located in a bathroom. And because the bathroom was so small, the coffeemaker was right next to the toilet. Bon appetite! There was practically no place for toiletries on the bathroom, and barely a space to dry oneself off after stepping out of the shower. The cafe on premises offered an early breakfast and then got closed. So if you're trying to get something to eat before you check out at the check out time, you're out of luck. Even though the difference in price between the suite we booked and the studio they put us in were $70/day, we did not get a refund, not did we get an apology for being inconvenienced. Despite the fact that this hotel positions itself as a boutique hotel, it's really not. You would get better accommodations staying at the quality motel or a regular chain hotel. To sum it up, you'd be better off staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Vile”
Reviews.Author: neimanmarxist
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really sub-par for the hefty sum they are charging. It is in a very good location, but the buck stops there. The rooms and furnishings are dingy and outdated. The carpet was faded and soiled-looking. The bed was lumpy. The duvet was not covered with a proper cover but rather had a large sheet folded over it so that the blanket would sometimes fall out of the cover. How many other hotel guests do you think touched that falling-out-of-the-cover duvet? Positively unsanitary. I had to put a towel over the ironing board when I ironed my clothes because the ironing board cover had some giant yucky stain on it. The lamps didn't work (none of them.) The bathroom stank of mildew- it was the old shower curtain that caused the smell. Ugh. The fitness center is on the 27th floor (though they won't tell you that. They'll let you think it's on the 26th floor until you have to go down to reception in their slow elevators to ask.) You can see the beams in the ceiling, with rusty nails sticking out of them. There's one treadmill, which is new-ish, two old exercise bikes, and a little bit of lifting equipment. Nothing special. The real kicker was that the a/c didn't work in the room at all and the sun rises right into the rooms, heating them up. It was 90* in my room when I woke up in the morning and I wasn't able to sleep because of the heat and discomfort. Regardless they charge like it's a four star hotel. Go somewhere else, preferably an actual four-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In need of renovation? Or is it old world charm?”
Reviews.Author: stephenco
Reviews.Content: Montreal is a charming, old city, and I thought that this hotel perfectly complemented that image. With its old furnitures and elevators, was it really trying to maintain its charm or is it in need of a renovation? I just can't tell. Whichever it is, the front desk staff were helpful and knowledgeable. The rooms were ok. Room internet was not free, but the internet at the business center (26th floor) was. I liked the location, though. It was a few minutes walk from Peel Street subway station, a stone's throw from McGill University and a few blocks away from some serious shopping and dining options.
